glsa.title: TWiki: Arbitrary command execution
glsa.synopsis: A bug in the TWiki search function allows an attacker to execute arbitrary commands with the permissions of the user running TWiki.

background.p: TWiki is a Web-based groupware tool based around the concept of wiki pages that can be edited by anybody with a Web browser.

description.p: The TWiki search function, which uses a shell command executed via the Perl backtick operator, does not properly escape shell metacharacters in the user-provided search string.

impact.p: An attacker can insert malicious commands into a search request, allowing the execution of arbitrary commands with the privileges of the user running TWiki (usually the Web server user).

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.
